Finding aid for
Penrod/Hiawatha Company
Postcard Collection, 1950-2014
titlepage.author:
Finding aid created by
Penrod/Hiawatha Company postcards

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The collection was the gift of John Penrod (Donor no. 7986) and first came to the library in 1991. Periodic additions have been received.

accruals.p: Periodic additions to the records are expected.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to research; images may not be reproduced for commercial use. Academic researchers wishing to reproduce postcards must contact the Penrod/Hiawatha Company to obtain permission.

userestrict.p: Copyright is held by the Penrod/Hiawatha Company.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Penrod/Hiawatha Company postcards, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: The Penrod/Hiawatha Company of Berrien Springs, Michigan, produces and distributes postcards and other photographic items for tourists. Photographer John Penrod (1930- ) founded the company in 1959 in Berrien Springs when he purchased a small postcard company in the city. Penrod gradually expanded his enterprise by purchasing competing postcard companies including the Hiawatha Card Company, A.E. Luce, L.L. Cook Company, Ludington News Company, Michigan Card Company, Pemble Brothers Wholesale, and Upper Michigan Press. In addition to postcards, Penrod/Hiawatha produces advertising, commercial, and tourist items, such as calendars, brochures, souvenir picture booklets, and business cards.

scopecontent.p: The Penrod/Hiawatha Company collection is mainly comprised of postcards, although some supplemental photographic items directed toward tourists is also included. The postcards, numbering more than 5,000, primarily are of the Michigan landscape and its towns and cities, covering every region of the state. Typical postcard themes dominate, particularly natural scenery, outdoor recreation, and shopping districts. The postcards date from the 1950s through the opening decades of the twenty-first century, although very few display copyright dates. The collection is divided into the following series.

list.item: Penrod/Hiawatha Postcards, mid- to late 1990s: Boxes 5-6

scopecontent.p: As batches of postcards are received every years, it was decided to arrange the items in blocks of time according to the date of their accession. Thus for the researcher interested in a specific city, it will be necessary to examine the listing for each of the series.

The Non-Postcard Items series contains brochures, booklets, and calendars produced by the Penrod/Hiawatha Company. The brochures are mainly advertisements for tourist attractions or services and are grouped alphabetically by city. The booklets focus on items of historical or scenic significance. The calendar collection contains several series of calendars dating from 1972. Each calendar usually has a different scenic theme.

The Non-Penrod/Hiawatha Postcards series is comprised of postcards produced in the 1950s and 1960s by various companies that were eventually purchased by John Penrod. They are arranged alphabetically by city. General postcards of non-specific Michigan locations follow the city listing.

The Penrod/Hiawatha Postcards series contain postcards produced in the 1970s up to the mid-1990s after Penrod purchased the Hiawatha Card Company The series was received as part of 1991-1995 accessions. The series is primarily arranged alphabetically by city. It also includes general postcards of non-specific Michigan locations and topics following the listing by city.

did.unittitle: Sleeping Bean National Park and Glen Lake

scopecontent.p: The Penrod/Hiawatha Postcards, ca. 1993-1998 series contain postcards produced in the mid to late 1990s which were received by the library in 1996 and 1998 accessions. The series is primarily arranged first by general postcards of non-specific Michigan locations and topics. This is followed by the listing by city.

did.unittitle: Lakes I (includes Burt, Gull, Elk, Long, Houghton, Higgins, Otsego, Torch, Glen, White, Crystal, Paw Paw, Charlevoix, Walloon)
Lakes II (includes Huron, Michigan, Silver Lake, Sister Lakes, Superior)
Miscellaneous (includes campsites, flag, maps, state gem, state stone)
Grand Rapids (Gerald Ford Museum, Frederick Meijer Gardens)

scopecontent.p: The Penrod/Hiawatha Postcards series contain postcards produced in the late 1990s to 2000 and was received as part of a 2000 accession. The series is primarily arranged first by general postcards of non-specific Michigan locations and topics. This is followed by the listing by city.

did.unittitle: Lakes I (includes Long, Higgins, Torch, Walloon)
Lakes II (includes Huron, Michigan, Silver Lake, Superior and Dunes)
Miscellaneous (includes collages, flags, maps, agates, state stone)
Grand Rapids (Gerald Ford Museum. John Bull Park Zoo)

scopecontent.p: The Penrod/Hiawatha Postcards, ca. 2001-2004 series contain postcards produced approximately 2001-2004. The series is primarily arranged first by general postcards of non-specific Michigan locations and topics. This is followed by the listing by city.

The Penrod/Hiawatha Postcards 2005-2014 series contain postcards produced approximately 2005-2014. The series is primarily arranged first by general postcards of non-specific Michigan locations and topics. This is followed by the listing by city, then such tourist destinations as lighthouses, parks, rivers, etc.

This series includes a photocopy of a two-page newspaper article containing biographical information about John Penrod and the Penrod/Hiawatha Postcard Company (Ann Arbor News, July 7, 1991). In addition, there are larger than average postcards, foldout souvenir postcard packets, and roadmaps used by Penrod in providing a geographic code to each postcard.

did.unittitle: Clippings relating John Penrod and his company 1991
State road maps used by Penrod in coding his postcards
